resources.string:
- The majority of nouns which come from verbs without a suffix (but often with a vowel change).
 - 60% of nouns in -el and -er.
 - 80% of nouns in -en.
 - 67% of monosyllabic nouns (the rest are 19% neuter and 14% feminine).
 - Nouns with "-er" arising from verbs.
 - Male humans (and their professions) and male animals.
 - Nouns of all seasons, months, days of the week.

- Most nouns ending in -t originating from verbs.
 - The main part (90%) of nouns in -e.
 - Nouns derived from adjectives with the suffix -nis.
 - Female humans (and their professions) and female animals.

- 90% of the nouns with the prefix "Ge-".
 - Chemical terms which end in "-in" and metals.
 - Nouns which stem from verb infinitives.
 - Two-thirds of nouns in -nis and -sal.
 - Most nouns ending in -al, -an, -ar, -är, -at, -ent, -ett, -ier, -iv, -o and -on (which are of foreign origin), provided that they desingnate things.
 - Nouns which comes from adjectives.
 - Human babies and animal babies.
-a, -anz, -ei, -enz, -heit, -ie, -ik, -keit, -schaft, -sion, -tät, -tion, -ung, -ur, -in (when it comes to female humans (and their professions) and female animals).
